alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Northern Foot Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 03 at 1:58PM MDT until April 07 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and the Black Hills of Wyoming and northwestern and the Black Hills of South Dakota. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...The high winds could blow down large trees and damage roofs, small outbuildings, and signs. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected at times Tuesday night through Wednesday. Several inches of snow are possible over the northern and Wyoming Black Hills, with minor accumulations possible elsewhere. Combined with the strong winds, the snow could lead to reduced visibilities and hazardous travel conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Northern Foot Hills
